body: hmm, the actual used size in a statically linked program may be smaller, but this seems pretty big for android - in some cases, we can get the whole android binary down to <2MB.   I don't know which is a better solution - using ifdefs to avoid using this library on android, or use the library only in the performance critical kernels?
